snippet: The United Nations health agency said the outbreak warranted extraordinary measures but stopped short of imposing a travel ban.
abstract: World Health Organization declares international public health emergency as Ebola outbreak spreads through West Africa, only third such declaration of its kind since regulations permitting such alarms were adopted in 2007.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from London, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations health agency said the outbreak warranted extraordinary measures but stopped short of imposing a travel ban.

headline.main: U.N. Agency Calls Ebola Outbreak an International Health Emergency
headline.print_headline: U.N. Agency Calls Ebola Outbreak an International Health Emergency
